answers.answer: People in Asia eat rice a lot and they have no problem with healthy babies!  I totally wouldn't worry about it.  Rice is a lot healthier, in my opinion, than a cheeseburger from McD's!As for the iron, I think it's because baby is *taking* your iron ...causing you to get "what's left."

My diabetes test came back fine but my doctor told me I was slightly anemic, so I take iron every other day (I take it every other day rather than every day because it makes me crampy/almost constipated).  As far as the gestiational diabetes goes, if the test comes back bad again I would talk to your doctor about how to change your eating habits - it may not be the rice but something else.

as long as my baby gets enough iron then I am happy I will just take extra for myself then.I will do something about the diet and I hope the test this saturday comes out fine.  thank you for your comments ladies. :0) made me feel a bit better

Avanaar is right, the iron is mostly going to your baby, so your getting whats left over!  It's nothing to concerning.  Iron also makes you constipated!  LOLBUT I don't think rice has any sugar in it does it?  I eat a lot of rice, and have never failed a test!  It's usually if you eat way to much sweets, candy, cake, brownies, pies, pop, juices etc.  And your body and the placenta can't break it all down.  Usually if you fail the first you past the second.If you fail the next one they automatically send you to see a nutritionist, to get a diet on track!  =)
hmm so it's not as bad as I thought then.. :0) I am such a worry wort sometimes.  Thanks for the advice :0) I appreciate you ladies helping me!

question: My nurse said my sugar is a bit high probably because me and DH love rice.  I am feeling guilty and sad at the same time for our baby.  It means I am not eating healthy enough? I will have another test on saturday to confirm if I needed medication to lower my sugar level everyday... I am not looking forward to this since it is a 12hour fasting and they have to draw blood on me more than once in a day and they have to keep me in the lab for two hours.Next is the Iron level.. It went down so I was given supplements... it used to be 114 when I started pregnancy and now it went to down to 110.....Does this mean my baby is not receiving enough iron (nutrients)? from me? I'd rather get less iron as long as he gets enough for himself.  I am not getting much sleep these days though...Ladies, please tell me he's getting enough... I am so sad today because of these results.
title: well did my diabetes test and hemoglobin level test... results are not on the good side
